title: Cuspidal robots: theoretical study, classification, and application to commercial robots
journal: Ecole Centrale de Nantes, LS2N, CNRS
abstract: Cuspidal robots are robots that have at least one connected region with multiple inverse kinematic solutions. This allows cuspidal robots to change solutions without crossing singularities. This doctoral thesis presents theoretical study on cuspidal analysis of 3R serial robots, identification algorithms for generic 6R robots, and trajectory planning implications for commercial cuspidal robots.
note: Advisors: Philippe Wenger and Damien Chablat

title: Optimal kinematic design of a robot mechanism for otological surgery
abstract: This thesis studies design requirements, constraints, and optimization strategy for an assistive endoscope manipulation mechanism in otological surgery, including kinematic synthesis, passive joint limits, collision constraints, and global-local optimization methodology.
note: Advisors: Damien Chablat, Marcello Sanguineti, Guillaume Michel and Shivesh Kumar
